item.title: Series of potholes and craters, 25th February
item.description:
On Dark lane, near the junction to Whitelands Lane there are a series of potholes and craters in the road. Made worse by the continuous gushing of water out of the back a little further up the road where a field drainage pipe looks to have been diverted onto the road out of a field
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dark Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Blocked Drain - Serious Safely Issue, 25th February
item.description:
This blocked drain is located on St Paul's Road opposite the junction to Folly Lane. As a regular cyclist along this this route I have had to take evasive action following moderate to heavy rainfall. The presence of surface water caused me to go around the blockage into not only oncoming traffic, but also that turning right exiting Folly Lane. This is quite dangerous for those cycling, using motorised wheel chairs or electric scooters. Only a couple of weeks ago a fatality occurred at this very junction. Could this tragic incident have been avoided had this drain been functioning properly? Having read that this drain was serviced back in May 2025 it wasn't done successfully. Also the double yellow lines on the same side of the road are also obscured and needs cleaning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Folly Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leckhampton Footpath 20 dug up and now left in ruins, 24th February
item.description:
The footpath referenced (USRN 06702426) has been dug up by workmen and destroyed. They were supposed to retarmac it, but didn't. It's now surrounded by fencing and signs saying it's closed. It's been like this for a week. We cannot now get from one side of the park to the other on the path. There has been no activity to sort out this mess. We assume that the council dug up the path, and want to know why the council hasn't completed the work started.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Wisteria Court, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Large Pothole on Previously 'Repaired' Pothole, 24th February
item.description:
What3Words - ///warns.grin.towels Previously fixed pothole come back even worse. It has been like this for a couple weeks getting gradually worse. The whole road is riddled with potholes and could probably do with resurfacing, especially with increased heavy traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vicarage Lane, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
